metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1372 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
ClamAV (aka Clam AntiVirus) before 0.99.2 allows remote attackers to causea denial of service (application crash) via a crafted 7z file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1372` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.99.2+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-base - 0.99.2+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.99.2+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.99.2+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.99.2+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.99.2+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libclamav7 - 0.99.2+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clamav package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.99.2+addedllvm-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
